clinical_study.brief_title: Strategic Intervention on Preserving Motor Function During Awake Craniotomy
clinical_study.official_title: Strategic Intervention on Preserving Motor Function With Application of Unipolar Stimulator During Awake Glioma Resection Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study aimed to compare the motor functions after traditional or a new surgical plan during awake glioma resection surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: This study concentrates on patients with type III motor area glioma. In the awake surgery, we compare the new surgical plan, which we use a monopolar stimulator to determine and retain the tumor margin within 5mm from the posterior limb of the inner capsule. For the traditional surgical plan, we use bipolar stimulator according to the current standard surgery plan. After the positive points are identified by stimulator, the positive points are retained in order to preserve the motor function while all the non-positive points of the tumor are resected. This study is to determine whether the new surgical plan is more suitable for type III motor area glioma patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Motor function preserved better in new surgical plan group
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Motor function of the patients in new surgical plan group is better preserved and recover faster than the patients in traditional surgical group.The difference between the motor functions of two groups are analyzed using t-test or chi-square test according to the type of data.

arm_group.description: We use a monopolar stimulator to determine and retain the tumor margin within 5mm from the posterior limb of the inner capsule in type III motor area glioma patients.

We use bipolar stimulator according to the current standard surgery plan. After the positive points are identified by stimulator, the positive points are retained in order to preserve the motor function while all the non-positive points of the tumor are resected.

intervention.description: The awake neurosurgical procedure performed on the brain is to provide a real-time neurological functions monitoring in order to preserve the functions to the greatest extent.
